alert.note: Alert for Marion (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:31PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN POWESHIEK...SOUTHEASTERN MARION AND MAHASKA COUNTIES... At 431 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bussey, or 10 miles north of Albia, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Eddyville, Beacon, Leighton, Oskaloosa, University Park, Keomah Village, Lake Keomah State Park, Oskaloosa Municipal Airport and Rose Hill. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central, central and southeastern Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
